title: Rework Soraka is frustrating to play
body:
**1.  Everything she does feels clunky
**
You want to move through jungle.  Random surges of speed.
You want to heal an ally.  Get punched in the face.
Healing again.  Too bad, they weren't in lap-dance range.
Trying to land a Q or E?  Sorry, opponents have a brain.  

Every skill except her ultimate has a noticeable, and annoying drawback.  Her Q and E are near impossible to land against a conscious enemy because of the massive delay.  Her heal is ridiculously limited; arguably the worst in the game.  If an ally is near death and 10 feet away, they die.  If you are at low life, you die.  Her passive is just random, and only needs to exist because the heal is so short ranged.  The snare on her E may as well not exist for how often it lands.  

**2.  Next to zero out-play potential
**
No character relies on their teammates as much as Soraka.  If your ADC is bad, Soraka is by default going to be bad.  Other supports can land a skillshot to set up a kill or use a signature skill like Morgana's Black Shield to change a fight.  Soraka has none of that.  ALL she can do is heal, Q, heal, Q, hope E lands, Heal, Q.  

This means in teamfights she does less than pretty much any other support to change the enemy teams gameplan.  The game becomes 5 versus slightly tougher 4, rather than a true 5v5.  And even then, Soraka's heal hurts her more than it helps her allies, so the illusion of toughness is just that.  Soraka is entirely dependent on her teammates making the plays to win any teamfight.  

**3.  No correct build path
**
Support items - Suicide
AP items - Suicide
Tank - Alive, but useless
ADC? - Well she'd at least do damage and have lifesteal for her W

**4.  Playing against her**
Can you kill her?  Yes/No.  If yes, she is useless.  If no, her team seems much tougher.  She's binary and offers very little outplay for opponents as well.  Her poke doesn't really matter, but she makes games feel grindy for both sides.

**4.  Conclusion**

Playing Soraka isn't playing League, it is spectating in a very annoying way.  She can only heal, and she does THAT worse than almost every other healing character in the game.  Her buildpaths and skills are clunky and nothing she does is satisfying.  Thresh can land a pull, Sona can ult an entire team.  Soraka can heal herself to death, or watch a teammate die.  Her clunkiness, ineptitude, and sheer lack of individual impact make her fundamentally unfun to play.  She is also pretty unfun to play against.

I'd like to respectfully disagree. New Soraka is a fantastic team fight champ and a decent laner.

First, you need to practice hard to use her abilities to their full potential. You can't just spam out the Q because bad placement makes it easily dodgeable, and you'll run out of mana because of the high cost of Q. You also need to frequently use her abilities for their zoning potential. You are a herder of sheep, you have to give them consequences for going their preferred direction, and make them go the wrong way to avoid your spells.

You can also do some really interesting things with the silence, but you have to tailor your usage very closely to the type of enemy champions you have. For instance, if you have an enemy ryze, save it for any time he Rune Prisons a teammate of yours. Then you drop the silence immediately and he'll just stand there like a clown. If there's an enemy Rengar, you have to save it until he pounces on someone, and then you entirely erase his burst and your team destroys him. For most burst champs, this ground-placed silence gives you tremendous out-play ability. If you can at any time remove their entire ability to burst, you will make them shit their pants. 

One trick is to drop the silence, and then *stop running*. You stand in one spot so that **they can auto-attack you while they stand on the silence circle**. This typically tricks them into standing on the silence for the full duration, while you hit them with precisely aimed Qs at short range. Your Q will more than compensate for any autos you receive from them, and you're guaranteed to receive no spellcasts from them. Then at the end, they get rooted, and you continue running away, dropping Q bombs from the heavens as you go.

Another aspect of outplaying assassins as Soraka is to build like a drain tank. You should spend your money on Armor and MR over health, so that each heal from your Q will be a larger percent of your total, and their damage does less. Combined with this is the healing enhancement of Spirit Visage, which is a tremendously valuable item on Soraka. With a SV and a frozen heart, and then any AP item, you're basically unkillable 1v1. You can also add AP on top of this for more sustain. 

Alternatively, Mikael's is also a fantastic Soraka item, since it gets you out of tight spots when you've spent too much on healing and perhaps missed some Qs. You might be zoned from hitting your Qs too easily because you have low health, but then a quick Mikael's active will get you back in the game and easily sustaining yourself again.

> Thresh can land a pull, Sona can ult an entire team. Soraka can heal herself to death, or watch a teammate die.

Why are you playing Soraka if CC is the thing you like on a support? To me, healing someone from 100 hp to 2000 in 4-6 seconds is extremely impactful.

She's also not binary. In order to heal, she always has to put herself at risk due to short range and self-damage on the heals. There is always a chance to kill her, and she can almost always fine a way to heal safely if she can dodge enemy abilities and stay on the outskirts of fights. That's not binary by any definition. Binary is when a champion has only 2 outcomes and there is no way for either them or their opponents to change it if they're on the wrong side. Soraka being squishy and vulnerable means enemies can always respond, and she can always respond by staying outside of the fight and silencing before throwing a good number of heals. You may not like Soraka's gameplay, but binary does not apply to her. It's just a buzzword here.

1. Her kit is different. I don't feel like her kit is clunky, she just plays differently.
2. It depends on who you end up with. Every time I play Soraka rework, my ADC plays smart and doesn't let themselves get hit too much. Soraka may not have kill potential outside of E, but at the same time, her lane is not that easy to kill either. Unless you are using E to poke (which you shouldn't) you can bait out enemies into your E to stop them from being aggressive. I've had Thresh, Blitzcrank, and junglers try to position themselves for a kill, only for me to throw a silence on them/in their path, giving us ample time to reposition away from their crosshairs while their plan fizzles.
3. She has an extremely versatile build path. And usually you'll build a mix of stats (I build AP and tank items, and am able to heal a good amount and stay alive)
4. That's what the rework was for: Make her THE ultimate healer (and she does that very well) and one way to counter that is murder her face.

As for Q and E being hard to hit, understandable they have a lot of power behind them. Q is a semi-decent poke ability AND it heals Soraka, so she can heal her lane partner, and they can ousustain your lane. E is already very powerful in that it's an AoE silence field. Even if you never root them at all, you can severely disrupt one of their champions by forcing them to reposition. She counters all in champions pretty hard  (such as Xin Zhao, Amumu, Talon, Akali, Katarina.) She's also a dangerous combo with anyone that has AoE CC, or an AoE trap such as Veigar's E or Jarvan IV's Ultimate (also works against him as well.)

Soraka seems more like the Riven of supports.  If your lane is ahead, it becomes impossible to kill.  If your behind, your heals have a hard time keeping up with the burst potential champs can do.  

Her E isn't a consistent peel.  It's good in large team fights for zone control.  It's good when comboed with other champions that have a snare, but it doesn't help ADC's get away from overwhelming damage.  Something that Thresh, Janna, Morg, and many others are able to do.  Silence is not a peel, it's a temporary rebuff where opponents cannot use their skills.  The root is situational at best.  

I really wanted to like soraka, I saw a lot of potential in her.  Unfortunately she has the same problems that old soraka did when it comes to peeling for an ADC.  Without a reliable root/snare, Soraka will never be a top tier support.  Look at the plays thresh and janna can make, then tell me why any world class player would pick soraka and give up those play making abilities.

I love Soraka's kit, but it is WAY too unforgiving.  It just does too little for the price.  Also, yes, the only viable build on Soraka atm is AD Soraka.  And even then you have to build friggin essence reaver on her because her mana never really stops being an issue, unless you build her as a support, which is pretty dang useless.  Let's compare this to another champion that I play as a support:  {{champion:41}}.


Put down the pitchforks and torches and listen.  Soraka has 4 builds.  Gangplank has 4 builds.  All of Soraka's builds kick you in the dick somewhere in the kit.  If you build AP, you have no sustain.  If you build support, you have no power.  If you build tank, you have no support capabilities.  If you build AD, you're completely going against why you picked Soraka in the first place.  Gangplank on the other hand has no real tradeoffs to any of his builds that directly inhibit his playstyle.  If you build him Critplank, you're not as tanky, but your W picks up the slack, and you'll be too busy doing 1200 damage to carries to care about sustained dueling.  If you build him APlank, he's not going to hit as hard, but his Q will still hurt, he will completely heal away all damage on him, and his ultimate becomes a lot more terrifying (not a particularly great build, but it's better than what Soraka's got to offer.)  If you build him as TankPlank, he becomes nigh impossible to lock down and kill, rivialing Singed with his disengage.  And finally, what would have been his worst build, but still works better than Soraka:  his support build, SupPlank.  What does SupPlank do?  It heals, harasses, and allows him to just be a downright pain in the ass if anyone goes in on the carry, because Gangplank will be wailing on them too.  By the time the damage drops off late-game, he'll have enough tank items to frontline for the carry so that they can engage safely from the back.

So let's compare Soraka and Gangplank.

* Soraka:  3 bad builds, 1 off-build that doesn't highlight her main foucs.

* Gangplank:  2 awesome bulids.  1 off-build that gets the job done, and 1-off build that still isn't complete bollocks.

I feel like Riot's so worried about giving these reworked champions "counterplay" that they forget to actually give them power in return.  Case and point:  {{champion:69}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:16}}
